title: CPU
description: The 'brain' of the computer. It does all the calculations and tasks.

title: RAM
description: Part of the memory that helps the computer be fast. It disappears when you turn it off.

title: URL
description: It's the 'address' of a website. Example: www.conex.com.br

title: API
description: A bridge that helps two programs talk to each other.

title: HTML
description: The language used to build internet pages.

title: SSD
description: A modern and very fast type of memory where files are stored.

title: Wi-Fi
description: A wireless connection to access the internet.

title: HTTP
description: A protocol used to browse websites. It's at the beginning of the links.

title: APP
description: Short for 'application,' like WhatsApp or YouTube.

title: Log in
description: To sign in to a website or system with a username and password.

title: Log out
description: To sign out of the system safely.

title: Set up
description: To configure a device or an account. Example: 'Set up' a new cell phone.

title: Back up
description: To make a copy of your files so you don't lose anything.

title: Scroll down
description: To roll the screen down to see more content.

title: Turn on
description: To switch on the computer, cell phone, or another device.

title: Turn off
description: To switch off the device safely.

title: Plug in
description: To connect a cable or charger to the device.

title: Figure out
description: To understand how something works. Example: 'Figure out' how to use an app.

title: Firewall
description: A 'digital wall' that protects your computer from viruses.

title: Cloud
description: A space on the internet to save photos, videos, and documents.

title: Download
description: To get something from the internet onto your device.

title: Upload
description: To send files from your device to a website or app.

title: Malware
description: A type of program that can harm your cell phone or computer.

title: Bug
description: An error that makes a system work the wrong way.

title: Browser
description: A program used to access the internet, like Google Chrome.

title: Software
description: The programs that make a computer work.

title: Hardware
description: The physical parts of a computer, like the keyboard and monitor.

title: Virtual Assistant
description: A robot that answers questions, like Siri or Alexa.

title: Voice Recognition
description: When a machine understands what you say. Example: 'Ok Google.'

title: Automatic Translation
description: A system that translates text from one language to another.

title: Smart Filter
description: The AI chooses what to show you based on what you like.

title: Chatbot
description: A robot that talks with you through messages, like in customer service.

title: Recommendation
description: The AI suggests music, videos, or products based on what you have already seen.

title: Face Detection
description: The camera recognizes your face to unlock your cell phone.

title: Auto-correction
description: The cell phone corrects words that you type wrong.

title: Predictive Text
description: The AI guesses what you are going to type and shows you options.

title: Teamwork
description: Working together with other people to reach a goal.

title: Problem-Solving
description: Finding solutions when something goes wrong.

title: Patience with Technology
description: Being calm to learn how to use new devices.

title: Always Learning
description: To keep learning and adapting, even when you are older.

title: Listen Carefully
description: To understand instructions well before you act.

title: Creativity
description: Thinking of new ways to do things.

title: Clear Communication
description: To speak in a simple and easy-to-understand way.

title: Decision-Making
description: Choosing what to do, even when you are not sure.

title: Empathy
description: To put yourself in someone else's shoes, especially when they are having a hard time.
